00036 KMuonModuleSubRecord& KMuonModuleSubRecord::operator=(const KMuonModuleSubRecord &aRec)
00037 {
00038         if(&aRec == this) return *this;
00039         
00040         this->KSubRecord::operator=(aRec);
00041         CopyLocalMembers(aRec);
00042         
00043         return *this;
00044 }
00045 
00046 void KMuonModuleSubRecord::CopyLocalMembers(const KMuonModuleSubRecord &aRec)
00047 {
00048         SetModuleNumber(aRec.GetModuleNumber());
00049         SetTdc(0, aRec.GetTdc(0));
00050         SetAdc(0, aRec.GetAdc(0));
00051         SetTdc(1, aRec.GetTdc(1));
00052         SetAdc(1, aRec.GetAdc(1));
00053         SetAdcGroup(aRec.GetAdcGroup());
00054 }

00056 void KMuonModuleSubRecord::Clear(Option_t *anopt)
00057 {
00058         //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00059   //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00060   //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00061   //inside of a TClonesArray
00062   //Also, if this class holds any TClonesArrays, it must call
00063   //TClonesArray::Clear("C")
00064         KSubRecord::Clear(anopt);
00065         
00066   //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00067         
00068   //Re initialize local members here and prepare for the next use of this class.
00069   InitializeMembers();
00070         
00071 }
00072 
00073 void KMuonModuleSubRecord::InitializeMembers(void)
00074 {
00075         //Init local members. 
00076         
00077   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00078   //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00079         SetModuleNumber(-99);
00080         SetTdc(0, -99);
00081         SetAdc(0, -99);
00082         SetTdc(1, -99);
00083         SetAdc(1, -99);
00084         SetAdcGroup(-99);
00085 }

00089 Int_t KMuonModuleSubRecord::GetTdc(Int_t i) const
00090 {
00091         if(i < kNumPmtsPerMuonModule)
00092                 return fTdc[i];
00093         else
00094                 return -1;
00095 } 
00096 
00097 Int_t KMuonModuleSubRecord::GetAdc(Int_t i) const
00098 {
00099         if(i < kNumPmtsPerMuonModule && i >= 0)
00100                 return fAdc[i];
00101         else
00102                 return -1;
00103 }
00104 
00105 Int_t KMuonModuleSubRecord::SetTdc(Int_t i, Int_t val)
00106 {
00107         if(i < kNumPmtsPerMuonModule && i >= 0){
00108                 fTdc[i] = val;
00109                 return val;
00110         }
00111         else
00112                 return -1;
00113 }
00114 
00115 Int_t KMuonModuleSubRecord::SetAdc(Int_t i, Int_t val)
00116 {
00117         if(i < kNumPmtsPerMuonModule && i >= 0){
00118                 fAdc[i] = val;
00119                 return val;
00120         }
00121         else
00122                 return -1;
00123 }

00125 Bool_t KMuonModuleSubRecord::IsSame(const KMuonModuleSubRecord &aRec, Bool_t bPrint) const
00126 {
00127         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00128         
00129         //call the base class's IsSame methods
00130         if(!this->KSubRecord::IsSame(aRec,bPrint)){
00131                 bIsEqual = false;
00132                 if(!bPrint)
00133                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00134                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00135         }
00136         
00137         if(fModuleNumber != aRec.fModuleNumber){
00138                 bIsEqual = false;
00139                 if (bPrint) 
00140                         cout << "KMuonModuleSubRecord fModuleNumber Not Equal. lhs: " 
00141                         << fModuleNumber << " != rhs " << aRec.fModuleNumber << endl;   
00142                 else
00143                         return false;  
00144         }
00145         
00146         for(Int_t i = 0; i < kNumPmtsPerMuonModule; i++){
00147                 if(fTdc[i] != aRec.fTdc[i]){
00148                         bIsEqual = false;
00149                         if (bPrint) 
00150                                 cout << "KMuonModuleSubRecord fTdc["<<i<<"] Not Equal. lhs: " 
00151                                 << fTdc[i] << " != rhs " << aRec.fTdc[i] << endl;                       
00152                         else
00153                                 return false;  
00154                 }
00155         }
00156         
00157         for(Int_t i = 0; i < kNumPmtsPerMuonModule; i++){
00158                 if(fAdc[i] != aRec.fAdc[i]){
00159                         bIsEqual = false;
00160                         if (bPrint) 
00161                                 cout << "KMuonModuleSubRecord fAdc["<<i<<"] Not Equal. lhs: " 
00162                                 << fAdc[i] << " != rhs " << aRec.fAdc[i] << endl;                       
00163                         else
00164                                 return false;  
00165                 }
00166         }
00167         
00168         if(fAdcGroup != aRec.fAdcGroup){
00169                 bIsEqual = false;
00170                 if (bPrint) 
00171                         cout << "KMuonModuleSubRecord fAdcGroup Not Equal. lhs: " 
00172                         << fAdcGroup << " != rhs " << aRec.fAdcGroup << endl;           
00173                 else
00174                         return false;  
00175         }
00176         return bIsEqual;
00177 }
00178 
00179 Bool_t KMuonModuleSubRecord::IsNeutronCounter(void)
00180 {
00181         //If fMuonModuleNumber is set to 50 or 51, then this event
00182         //contains information for the Neutron Counter and not for the Muon
00183         //Veto System. 
00184         
00185         return (fModuleNumber == 50 || fModuleNumber == 51);
00186 }
00187 
00188 void KMuonModuleSubRecord::Compact(void)
00189 {
00190         //make the event class as small as possible. this calls 'Compact' for all member
00191         //variables that are KDS classes, member variables that can be compacted (such as TBits)
00192         //and base classes
00193         
00194         KSubRecord::Compact();
00195 }
00196 
00197 Bool_t KMuonModuleSubRecord::IsHardTrigger()
00198 {
00199         //returns true if both TDC values have a value > -1.
00200         //Note, this means that a TDC value of 0 indicates a
00201         //trigger. 
00202         
00203         return (  (fTdc[0] > -1) && (fTdc[1] > -1)  );
00204 }
